noun.description: An instance or utterance of the cabbalistic word abrasax, supposed (especially in Gnosticism) to act as a charm. Frequently attributive, especially with reference to inscribing such a charm on a stone.

origin: Mid 18th century. From Hellenistic Greek Ἀβρασάξ, variant of Ἀβράξας abraxas. Compare earlier abraxas.
